The capacity of compounds of the plant origin to treat and prevent diseases might be related to the different biomolecules present within them. These phytochemicals and active ingredients include phenolic compounds, flavonoids, tannins, and alkaloids. The phytochemicals from medicinal plants are noted for their different antimicrobial abilities. Therefore, such phytochemicals could be developed as antimicrobial drugs. Several scholars have evaluated the antimicrobial activities of various plant components in recent years.
